intro: Platystephium graveolens, commonly known as the stinking rock-rose, is a perennial shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, often pungent leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in inflorescences. Platystephium graveolens is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
